body_html:
On the advice of a colleague, I have submitted a change
that registers the operations
GetSessionHandle GetSessionHandleV2 GetSessionTensor DeleteSessionTensor
as stateful. That's good, because they are. But in addition it should fix this problem,
because it will also tell the system to avoid constant folding on these operations.
It was the combination of the constant folding together with the experimental
GetSessionHandle op.

So in a few days when the change hits github, this should be fixed.

On the advice of a colleague, I have submitted a change
that registers the operations
GetSessionHandle GetSessionHandleV2 GetSessionTensor DeleteSessionTensor
as stateful.   That's good, because they are.   But in addition it should fix this problem,
because it will also tell the system to avoid constant folding on these operations.
It was the combination of the constant folding together with the experimental
GetSessionHandle op.
So in a few days when the change hits github, this should be fixed.
body:
On the advice of a colleague, I have submitted a change
that registers the operations
   GetSessionHandle GetSessionHandleV2 GetSessionTensor DeleteSessionTensor
as stateful.   That's good, because they are.   But in addition it should fix this problem,
because it will also tell the system to avoid constant folding on these operations.
It was the combination of the constant folding together with the experimental
GetSessionHandle op.

So in a few days when the change hits github, this should be fixed.
